alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 6:50AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Increase Snowmelt Across The Southeast Interior This Weekend... Warmer temperatures this weekend will cause increased melting of the snowpack across the Southeast Interior, with the amount of melt water increasing dramatically this weekend across the Southeast Interior. Today and Thursday will see highs in the 40s and lower 50s, but Friday will see highs rising into the 50s, with highs near 60 over the weekend. Low temperatures will be in the upper 20s and lower 30s. These warm temperatures will cause the snowpack to warm and melt rapidly this weekend. Snow will melt quickest on south facing slopes and around buildings and pavement. Most of the Southeast Interior still has over 5 inches of water in the snowpack, with some higher elevation areas having over 1 foot of water in the snowpack. Water will pond in low lying areas, and could get deeper in areas where drainages remain frozen. People in low lying or poorly drained areas should prepare for potential flooding that could develop this week as the snowmelt increases. Preparations include clearing ice out of drain pipes, culverts and drainage ditches. Preparations also include moving vehicles to higher ground, and moving valuables in basements and garages to shelves above the ground.
